document.heading: District of Columbia Government Employer-Assisted Housing Act of 1992

history.narrative: Law 9-118, the “District of Columbia Government Employer-Assisted Housing Act of 1992,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 9-210, which was referred to the Committee on Housing. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on March 3, 1992, and April 7, 1992, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on April 24, 1992, it was assigned Act No. 9-192 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 9-118 became effective on June 11, 1992.

annoGroup.heading: Delegation of Authority
annoGroup.annotation: Delegation of authority under D.C. Law 9-118, the District of Columbia Government Employer-Assisted Housing Act of 1992, see Mayor’s Order 92-118, October 6, 1992.

annoGroup.heading: Editor's Notes
annoGroup.text: Mayor authorized to issue rules: Section 9 of D.C. Law 9-118 provided that the Mayor shall, pursuant to subchapter I of Chapter 5 of Title 2, issue rules within 90 days after June 11, 1992, to implement the provisions of this act.

Section 8(c) of D.C. Law 10-70 added § 6b to D.C. Law 9-118, which provided that the Mayor shall, pursuant to subchapter I of Chapter 5 of Title 2, issue rules within 90 days after February 23, 1994 to implement the provisions of the act. The rules shall include, but not be limited to, the following:

District of Columbia Government Employer-Assisted Housing Act Rulemaking Approval Resolution of 1992: Pursuant to Resolution 9-358, effective December 11, 1992, the Council approved rules to carry out the purposes of the District of Columbia Government Employer-Assisted Housing Act of 1992.
Mayor authorized to issue rules: (1) An application procedure for the Metropolitan Police Housing Assistance Program; and.

(2) A standard of eligibility and selection of Metropolitan Police Housing Assistance Program applicants. The Mayor may establish priorities for eligibility based on length of residency in the District, geographic location, or other means as deemed appropriate.

D.C. Law 12-59, title XI, § 1101 ( 44 DCR 7356), eff. March 20, 1998, provided for the temporary repeal of §§ 45-2221 to 45-2226 [1981 Ed.]. Section 2001(b) of D.C. Law 12-59 provided for expiration “after 225 days of its having taken effect.”

annoGroup.heading: Temporary Amendment of Section
annoGroup.annotation: For temporary (225 day) amendment of section, see § 6(a) of Metropolitan Police Housing Assistance Program and Community Safety Temporary Act of 1993 (D.C. Law 10-63, October 8, 1993, law notification 40 DCR ]).

annoGroup.heading: Editor's Notes
annoGroup.annotation: D.C. Law 12-59, title XI, § 1101 ( 44 DCR 7356), eff. March 20, 1998, provided for the temporary repeal of §§ 45-2221 to 45-2226 [1981 Ed.]. Section 2001(b) of D.C. Law 12-59 provided for expiration “after 225 days of its having taken effect.”

section.heading: Assistance available for Metropolitan police officers.

annoGroup.heading: History
annoGroup.annotation: as added Feb. 23, 1994, D.C. Law 10-70, § 8(b), 40 DCR 7575

annoGroup.heading: Temporary Addition of Section
annoGroup.annotation: For temporary (225 day) addition, see § 6(b) of Metropolitan Police Housing Assistance Program and Community Safety Temporary Act of 1993 (D.C. Law 10-63, October 8, 1993, law notification 40 DCR ]).

annoGroup.heading: Emergency Legislation
annoGroup.annotation: For temporary (90-day) addition of section, see § 2 of the Government Employer-Assisted Housing Emergency Amendment Act of 1999 (D.C. Act 13-188, December 1, 1999, 46 DCR 10407).
For temporary (90-day) addition of section, see § 2 of the Government Employer-Assisted Housing Legislative Review Emergency Amendment Act of 1999 (D.C. Act 13-258, February 9, 2000, 47 DCR 1124).

annoGroup.heading: Editor's Notes
annoGroup.text: Mayor authorized to issue rules: Section 5 of D.C. Law 10-70 provided that the Mayor shall, pursuant to subchapter I of Chapter 5 of Title 2, issue rules within 90 days after February 23, 1994, to implement the provisions of this chapter. The rules shall include, but not be limited to, the following:
Mayor authorized to issue rules: (1) An application procedure for the Metropolitan Police Housing Assistance Program; and.

(2) A standard of eligibility and selection of Metropolitan Police Housing Assistance Program applicants. The Mayor may establish priorities for eligibility based on length of residency in the District, geographic location, or other means as deemed appropriate.

D.C. Law 12-59, title XI, § 1101 ( 44 DCR 7356), eff. March 20, 1998, provided for the temporary repeal of §§ 45-2221 to 45-2226 [1981 Ed.]. Section 2001(b) of D.C. Law 12-59 provided for expiration “after 225 days of its having taken effect.”
